channel.title: Posts on Wenbo Lv
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Wenbo Lv

item.title: awesome gis papers
item.description: On spatial effects in geographical analysis Spatial Dependence A generalized heterogeneity model for spatial interpolation atakrig: An R package for multivariate area-to-area and area-to-point kriging predictions Spatial Stratefied Heterogeneity(SSH) Geodetector: Principle and prospective An optimal parameters-based geographical detector model(OPGD) Modeling of spatial stratified heterogeneity sandwichr: Spatial prediction in R based on spatial stratified heterogeneity Identifying determinants of spatio-temporal disparities in soil moisture of the Northern Hemisphere using a geographically optimal zones-based heterogeneity model

item.title: Common git commands
item.description: View the git installation location which git View the git installation version git --version Updating Git for Windows git update-git-for-windows Setting up network proxy git config --global http.proxy 'http://127.0.0.1:7890' git config --global https.proxy 'http://127.0.0.1:7890' Setting default initial branch name to main git config --global init.defaultBranch main View all git configuration information git config --global --list Push local main to GitHub main and have local main track main on GitHub git push --set-upstream origin main # shorter form git push -u origin main # you only need to set upstream tracking once!

item.title: rmarkdown setup
item.description: 常用的 knitr 设置 ```{r setup, include = FALSE} knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE, dpi = 300, warning = FALSE, message = FALSE, out.width = "100%", out.height = "100%", fig.align = 'center', comment = "##") ``` 灰白背景rmarkdown模板 --- title: "xxx" author: "xxx" date: "`r Sys.Date()`" output: #latex_document prettydoc::html_pretty: theme: tactile highlight: github --- ```{r setup, include = FALSE} knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE, dpi = 300, warning = FALSE, message = FALSE, out.width = "100%", out.

item.title: Setting up a network proxy
item.description: Python import os os.environ["http_proxy"] = "http://127.0.0.1:7890" os.environ["https_proxy"] = "http://127.0.0.1:7890" R Sys.setenv(https_proxy="http://127.0.0.1:7890") Sys.setenv(http_proxy="http://127.0.0.1:7890") Julia ENV["https_proxy"]="http://127.0.0.1:7890/" Git git config --global http.proxy 'http://127.0.0.1:7890' git config --global https.proxy 'http://127.0.0.1:7890' nodejs npm config set https-proxy http://127.0.0.1:7890 Change the value from 7890 to the corresponding port number based on your network proxy port number.
